title: Locate your lost belongings in more ways with Find Hub on Android.

excerpt: Android’s Find My Device has been helping you locate your belongings for years. Now, with the evolution of Find My Device into Find Hub, we're making it even easier to locate your belongings, family and friends — alongside a growing list of partners.There will soon be even more personalized styles, too. Whether it’s built-in luggage finding from July and Mokobara, keeping your skis safe on the mountain with Peak integration, or adding a touch of fun with Disney-themed Bluetooth tags from Pixbee, there’s something for everyone. Later this month, we're also bringing you new nearby finding capabilities with ultra-wide band (UWB) enabled tags, first available on moto tag.Later this year, Find Hub will take safety even further with the integration of satellite connectivity, helping you stay connected with friends and family even when you don’t have cellular connectivity.And traveling is about to get even smoother. Thanks to our partnerships, you’ll be able to easily share your Bluetooth tag's location with some of your favorite airlines early next year, making recovering your lost luggage a breeze.

html:
Android’s Find My Device has been helping you locate your belongings for years. Now, with the evolution of Find My Device into Find Hub, we're making it even easier to locate your belongings, family and friends — alongside a growing list of partners.

There will soon be even more personalized styles, too. Whether it’s built-in luggage finding from July and Mokobara, keeping your skis safe on the mountain with Peak integration, or adding a touch of fun with Disney-themed Bluetooth tags from Pixbee, there’s something for everyone. Later this month, we're also bringing you new nearby finding capabilities with ultra-wide band (UWB) enabled tags, first available on moto tag.

Later this year, Find Hub will take safety even further with the integration of satellite connectivity, helping you stay connected with friends and family even when you don’t have cellular connectivity.

And traveling is about to get even smoother. Thanks to our partnerships, you’ll be able to easily share your Bluetooth tag's location with some of your favorite airlines early next year, making recovering your lost luggage a breeze.
